intro: Dicerandra linearifolia var. linearifolia, commonly known as the linear-leaved dicerandra, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The species is known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
